bug.short_desc: StackOverflowException in abbreviated RDF XML writer when associating project area from RTC

long_desc.thetext: 1. Run the OSLC4JBugzilla adapter 2. Start the project area association scenario from RTC 3. Before products in Bugzilla are displayed, OSLC4JBugzilla console shows what looks to be a stack overflow in RdfXmlAbbreviatedWriter.

The issue occurs when there are cycles in the graph. In the Bugzilla adapter the oslc:details for the service contains the same subject as the service itself.
The fix will be to keep track of visited resources when traversing the graph. Similar to what had to be done in the Jena and Json model helpers.

Resolved by:
https://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=52ae875d4b91b56348111a8f9cf1eb79cd04177c
There are two main fixes:
1) Keep track of which edges have been visited in all serialized graphs and don't recurse visited edges 2) Improve calculation of root objects in the graph - all non-anonymous resources and all anonymous resources not the object of other resources are proposed roots - all proposed roots are tested against the other proposed roots + the object resources in the graph. If they are contained in the model for any of these resources, they are removed as proposed roots.
Bulk update: Closing out Lyo bugs fixed long ago. Feel free to reopen if you feel your bug was closed in error.

bug.short_desc: Generated service class needs to set OSLC-Core-Version header

long_desc.thetext: For PUT and DELETE, we should not use Response.created() but Response.OK() instead. created() is to indicate that a resource is created, which should be reserved for POST methods.
Oops, that was a copy/paste error.

bug.short_desc: GDPR compliance

long_desc.thetext:
I have removed the GA cookies from the code but the HTML need to be changed to have more links or switch to the Quicksilver theme we were using before. I don't have time till 24th to do it. Can anyone give me a hand with this, please?
Here are the requirements:
***
Project sites who are not using the Quicksilver theme will need to make sure that their website is fully compliant with the GDPR (http://ec.europa.eu/justice/smedataprotect/index_en.htm).
While we may identify additional requirements in the following weeks, at a minimum our audit will include confirming a project website fulfills the following requirements: 1. All project web pages must include a footer that prominently links back to key pages, and a copyright notice. The following minimal set of links must also be included on the footer for all pages in the official project website:
1. Main Eclipse Foundation website (http://www.eclipse.org);
2. Privacy policy (http://www.eclipse.org/legal/privacy.php);
3. Website terms of use (http://www.eclipse.org/legal/termsofuse.php);
4. Copyright agent (http://www.eclipse.org/legal/copyright.php); and
5. Legal (http://www.eclipse.org/legal).
2. Approved Eclipse logos are available on the Eclipse Logos and Artwork page: https://eclipse.org/artwork/
3. A user must be requested to give their consent, and explicit consent must be given by the user before a project website can start using cookies. This requirement also includes cookies used by 3rd party services such as, but not limited to: Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and social media widgets.
4. Project websites must not collect and/or store and/or display personal information.
5. Project websites using 3rd party services such as, but not limited to, google analytics must be explicit about which company or companies have access to the data collected. For example, the project website must identify on their website the individuals or organizations who have access to google analytics data.
We are currently using Bug 534384 - The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) at the Eclipse Foundation https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=534384 to define action items that we must do before the GDPR deadline!
***

I vote to switch to the Quicksilver theme, if it is easy to perform. Less maintenance work for us in the end. If someone can help with that, I can fix with the content.
Here's my analysis and proposal.
There are 3 pages we need to deal with: 1. https://www.eclipse.org/lyo/ * The homepage. 2. https://www.eclipse.org/lyo/download.html * Linked at from the homepage above 3. https://www.eclipse.org/lyo/download.php * Linked to from https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/technology.lyo * NOTICE that this page has the eclipse header and Footer!
Proposal: 1. delete the two download page. Is there a reason to have these old pages? They refer to 2.1.1. And, we no longer expect people to download! Instead, link to the following https://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo/creating_OSLC4J_project
2. We worked hard to update the Lyo wiki frontpage https://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo Duplicate that content under the homepage https://www.eclipse.org/lyo/
3. Edit the project page to link to pages on the wiki https://projects.eclipse.org/projects/technology.lyo/edit#
Page 3 is using the Quicksilver theme, that's why it has all the links.
FYI, 'http://git.eclipse.org/c/gerrit/www.eclipse.org/lyo.git/' is THE lyo website repo

(In reply to Andrii Berezovskyi from comment #2) > Page 3 is using the Quicksilver theme, that's why it has all the links.
Nice. Then it is easy. so, how about my proposal? I am aware of the lyo repo to update.
https://www.eclipse.org/lyo/ is now updated.

bug.short_desc: Dom based cross site scripting in generated code by Lyo Code Generator

long_desc.thetext:
IBM App Scan Reports issues related with DOM Based Cross-Site scripting in the generated delegated JS files.
Issue 1: DOM Based Cross-Site Scripting Severity: High CVSS Score: 7.5 URL: https://localhost:9443/iotp/services/bmx/4dfeca77-98e0-49ba-b5d6-23fe67d4b436/resources/selector Entity: delegatedui.js:138 (Page) Risk: It may be possible to steal or manipulate customer session and cookies, which might be used to impersonate a legitimate user, allowing the hacker to view or alter user records, and to perform transactions as that user Causes: The web application uses client-side logic to create web
Following function in delegatedui.js file is using retunsURL as without validation and can lead to XSS. ------------------------------------------------------------- function respondWithWindowName( /*string*/ response) { 136 var returnURL = window.name; 137 window.name = response; 138 window.location.href = returnURL; 139 140 } -------------------------------------------------------------

Thanks Rahul,
Could you please submit a patch via Gerrit? I can look at it during the weekend.

Thanks Rahul! Andrii! Since this touches the generator templates, I think it easier if I simply do the coding. I will not be able to test it, but trust that the code already works. I hope Rahul can validate that it is working.
New Gerrit change created: https://git.eclipse.org/r/120164
Gerrit change https://git.eclipse.org/r/120164 was merged to [master]. Commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.tools.git/commit/?id=f9b610eb25fa465f53bdd21361087e77c7c7e094
New Gerrit change created: https://git.eclipse.org/r/120201

We are using window.name as a way to transmit data. Data MAY contain any of the characters you are trying to replace. Read up on this here: https://www.sitepen.com/blog/2008/07/22/windowname-transport/ and https://grack.com/blog/2010/01/04/more-on-window-name-cross-domain-transports/
I am thinking to close this issue as WONTFIX or to remove such code completely if the spec allows us to do so. Let's actually try to run this code (ie get the respondWithWindowName function triggered) and try an attack. Rahul, please give us the steps to reproduce. In the meantime I will read up on the standard if we can kill this feature (every modern browser supports postMessage - supported since IE 8.0).
Gerrit change https://git.eclipse.org/r/120201 was merged to [master]. Commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.tools.git/commit/?id=f5af821e7f3e6648cf0a64db7d17e81177f43501

Created attachment 273316 Attached the IBM App Scan report for Dom Based cross site scripting
Hi Jad, Andrii, I have attached the detailed report which describes about the Issue in detail and also the remediation for it.
Please have a look and let me know if you have any queries.
Thanks, Rahul

Hi Andrii,
Let me answers the questions: * unclear IP provenance <Rahul> The code I have suggested for change is written by originally written by me only and the same I have copy pasted from my workspace.
* the patch modifies the data silently instead of alerting the user/developer <Rahul> The code changes will sanitize the cross site scripting chracters by encoding it. Which means the data will display as it as without executing it on browser.
* finally, the patch is just wrong. the quotes are escaped, but the data passed through those variables is JSON!!! http://oslc.ld.berezovskyi.me/bin/view/Main/RmDelegatedUIV1#Format_of_Message <Rahul> We are not encoding any JSON response at all. The code only sanitizes the returnURL present in 'respondWithWindowName' method which expects a windows.name as a value which should be a string as I believe.
Thanks, Rahul

Rahul, thank you for confirming you are the original author of the code.
So I did some reading and here is some info:
The client selects a protocol via a hash-uri: http://oslc.ld.berezovskyi.me/bin/view/Main/RmDelegatedUIV1#Protocol_Selection Very SADLY, it is a MUST and we should reconsider downgrading it in OSLC 3, esp if there were good security reasons for the browsers to restrict the communication between a page and its iframe (however, Mozilla is saying that is it safer than JSONP: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/name ).
UPD: before sending this, I did a small check and it seems that indeed the iframe can give us a bad callback URL so that our page will allow the potential attacker to take more info from the host page than they should. See the attachment. BTW, the POC has defeats your protection.
I suggest we validate the URL using this https://validatejs.org/#validators-url and if it is OK, we change the window.location, otherwise, we console.log() that X is not a valid URL, which violates the 'oslc-windowName-1.0' protocol.
/Andrew
Opened an IP request to use validate.js: https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=16014
Created attachment 273322 POC

(In reply to Andrii Berezovskyi from comment #11) > Rahul, thank you for confirming you are the original author of the code. > > So I did some reading and here is some info: > > The client selects a protocol via a hash-uri: > http://oslc.ld.berezovskyi.me/bin/view/Main/ > RmDelegatedUIV1#Protocol_Selection Very SADLY, it is a MUST and we should > reconsider downgrading it in OSLC 3, esp if there were good security reasons > for the browsers to restrict the communication between a page and its iframe > (however, Mozilla is saying that is it safer than JSONP: > https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/name ). > > UPD: before sending this, I did a small check and it seems that indeed the > iframe can give us a bad callback URL so that our page will allow the > potential attacker to take more info from the host page than they should. > See the attachment. BTW, the POC has defeats your protection. > > I suggest we validate the URL using this > https://validatejs.org/#validators-url and if it is OK, we change the > window.location, otherwise, we console.log() that X is not a valid URL, > which violates the 'oslc-windowName-1.0' protocol. > > /Andrew
Hi Andrew,
Thanks for the updates.
I show the POC and also tried sanitizing it using escapeCSSAttack function before assigning value to window.location and it works for me. window.location=escapeCSSAttack("javascript:(alert(document.getElementById('secret').textContent));"); But this approach is not full proof as it's only encoding few characters.
We can also validate the URL and raise logs however if it's not valid then not assigning value to window.location will break the functionality Is my understanding correct ?

Thank Rahul,
I must have missed something with your escapeXSS function, my apologies!
If you modify the URL, the request is likely to fail anyway, so it might be better to fail fast and give feedback to the devs.

Hi Rahul & Andrii
Have you settled on a solution for this? We don't have to have the perfect solution.
i am happy to code the generator, once i get sample java code

Rahul, Jad,
Is it possible to set up a branch of a sample project for me to test this hands-on please?
I apologise for the delay, but I don't have a few hours now just to try setting this up.
/A

I have setup the branch B532687-B532688-CrossSite on https://github.com/OSLC/lyo-adaptor-sample-modelling
The adaptor-rm-webapp has a working selectionDialog you can test with. But it does not include any of the suggested code below.
Andrii! is that good enough, or do you need Rahul to add the necessary code tehre? I no longer know which code from the suggestions below are valid.

So, I tried it and here is the summary:
The whole thing does not work. When I disabled the modern HTML5 method of using messages 'oslc-core-postMessage-1.0' and switched to 'oslc-core-windowName-1.0', the URI that we are do desperately trying to sanitise turned out to be "". Setting it on a selection resets the iframe. Take a look at my commit in the branch Jad created.
The right way to do it seems too long: https://open-services.net/wiki/core/Delegated-User-Interface-Dialogs-3.0/#The-UI-Consumers-responsibilities_1 (or I am too tired in the evening).
Plus postMessage way is better and supported in every modern browser including IE: https://caniuse.com/#feat=x-doc-messaging
Plus OSLC 3 removed windowName way and only left postMessage way to communicate: https://tools.oasis-open.org/version-control/svn/oslc-core/trunk/specs/dialogs.html
Therefore, I propose to fix this security issue by removing support for 'oslc-core-windowName-1.0' completely. If some company needs to support IE10 and lower, they are welcome to contribute proper JS patch.
New Gerrit change created: https://git.eclipse.org/r/122815
Gerrit change https://git.eclipse.org/r/122815 was merged to [master]. Commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.tools.git/commit/?id=cc01bf8c327547c259aa61bf51a5801a4a01196d
Rahul, please reopen if not fully resolved in your opinion.

bug.short_desc: StackOverflowException when extended property refers to the current resource

long_desc.thetext:
Hitting a StackOverflowException due to infinite recursion when an extended property has a reference to the current resource. Example: A ChangeRequest has the following subject:
<rdf:Description rdf:about="https://jazz.net/jazz/resource/itemName/com.ibm.team.workitem.WorkItem/116496">
and contains the following attribute:
<rtc_cm:com.ibm.team.workitem.linktype.textualReference.textuallyReferenced rdf:resource="https://jazz.net/jazz/resource/itemName/com.ibm.team.workitem.WorkItem/116496" />
In JenaModelHelper (and the Json equivalent), this causes us to recurse infinitely between fromResource() and handleExtendedPropertyValue().
Proposed solution is to maintain a set of visited URIs during extended property passing and skip recursion if a particular URI has already been visited.
Need to be sure to test round-tripping of artifacts with unknown properties and blank nodes.

Resolved by the following commits:
https://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=dacd142b6956e32f86487656d0869dcf43072163 https://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=bef260c57d466432ab665a9c4fdd501af733c3c2 https://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=fdce5968e71355fc076e946978ae1a817b62f4bb

bug.short_desc: Failing JUnit testRetrieveCompact

long_desc.thetext:
It appears our JUnits require are written to run in a certain order. This is not a good practice, and JUnit does not guarantee order. In this case, at least in my environment, the testRetrieveCompact JUnit is running after testDelete, so the resource has already been deleted.
The problem can be fixed by adding @BeforeClass to the create test and @AfterClass to the delete test.
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: null at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47) at junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:20) at junit.framework.Assert.assertNotNull(Assert.java:214) at junit.framework.Assert.assertNotNull(Assert.java:207) at org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.test.test.TestTypesBase.testRetrieveCompact(TestTypesBase.java:319) at org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.test.test.TestTypesJson.testRetrieveCompact(TestTypesJson.java:51)

I've updated the two failing test classes to use setUp() for create and tearDown() for delete. Unfortunately, we're using JUnit 3 style tests, so @BeforeClass and @AfterClass aren't an option. I haven't changed any other tests.
Longer term, it would be better to move to JUnit 4 style tests.

bug.short_desc: Unmarshal 'Compact' resource with 'Preview' inlined not correct

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 250947 compact xml output
Hey,
as the title says the small and large previews are not unmarshalled correctly.
The unmarshalled 'Compact'-object holds a 'Preview'-object (e.g. for small Preview) but all attributes are set to null.
To reproduce the bug I attached a sample xml output by IBM Jazz server 5.0.1.
I tracked it down to the JenaModelHelper.

(In reply to Benjamin Roehl from comment #0)
I don't believe the RDF is correct. You might log this as a defect against the IBM product. When I check the W3C RDF validator, there is intermediate resource I wouldn't expect.
http://www.w3.org/RDF/Validator/
I think it's due to the rdf:parseType="Resource" attribute, which is for omitting blank nodes. It's not correct here.
http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-rdf-syntax/#section-Syntax-parsetype-resource

(In reply to Samuel Padgett from comment #1)
Thanks Samuel, I successfully tested it by removing both 'rdf:parseType' attributes. I forward this further to IBM Jazz Team ;)
Resolving as invalid (see comment #1). Benjamin, let us know if you disagree. Thanks!
Closed due to inactivity.

bug.short_desc: sharepoint sample odata4j->eclipselink Maven repository Corrupt jar file error

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 217512 odata4j v0.4 pom with corrected eclipselink reference
While building the samples I found that the sharepoint connector would not build due to an upstream problem in the eclipselink version being referred to by the odat4j project. The version of odata4j is 0.4, and it points to eclipselink 2.1.2. The repository for eclipselink project no longer shows version 2.1.2 in its released packages, and the repository initially could not find that version. After some adjustments (pointing to odata4j version 0.5) I was able to get maven to find eclipselink 2.1.2, but the resulting jar file was corrupt, so the build still failed. By editing the odata4j pom to point to eclipselink version 2.1.3 I was able to clear the problem.
I have attached the corrected odata4j pom.

1. Add the eclipselink maven repo to the sharepoint adapter pom 2. Lock the transitive dependency at 2.1.3.
Resolved by the following commit:
https://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.server.git/commit/?id=4ffb0ae3b97e8559546b202201f2dfe12d6694f1
*** Bug 360186 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

bug.short_desc: Generated getETag methods in AdaptorManager do not match the called methods in the Services classes.

long_desc.thetext:
The generated getETag methods in AdaptorManager do not match the called methods in the Services classes.
The getETag() methods in AdaptorManager are generated for each single Resource. For CreationFactories that are meant to manage a set of resources, the getETag() method name is expected to be of the form getETagResource1AndResource2And...
The later methods are missing, if you declare creationFactories to handle more than 1 resource.
New Gerrit change created: https://git.eclipse.org/r/95216
Gerrit change https://git.eclipse.org/r/95216 was merged to [master]. Commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=6daebbe444501e409a4185bcee6e7d9674b18df8
I mark it as resolved because the commit was merged into master. Please close it if it works for you.
Fixed in 2.2.0

Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/hp/hpl/jena/graph/NodeFactory at com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.graph.NodeConst.<clinit>(NodeConst.java:31) at com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.lang.ParserBase.<init>(ParserBase.java:62) at com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.lang.SPARQLParserBase.<init>(SPARQLParserBase.java:49) at com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.lang.sparql_11.SPARQLParser11Base.<init>(SPARQLParser11Base.java:22) at com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.lang.sparql_11.SPARQLParser11.<init>(SPARQLParser11.java:4953) at com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.lang.ParserSPARQL11Update._parse(ParserSPARQL11Update.java:58)
The library has been cleared in the https://dev.eclipse.org/ipzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=12405 and the workaround currently is to use dependencyManagement to enforce the dependency version in the end project.
I would strongly suggest we do this for 2.2.0, which is this week if we plan to release on Friday.

Created attachment 214586 Errors mentioned in text and maven sure fire (test) reports
List of initial errors. maven sure fire reports of tests during maven>install

There are a few things going on here:
1. @Override errors - these should not be happening - Taking the @Override out might compile but you'll have runtime issues. From the output looks like you are missing the geronimo-servlet dependency which should come from maven install
2. The tag library errors for the JSPs. I have seen that too - it is usually ok. We're investigating why that happens. Things should still work.
3. java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/xmlrpc/XmlRpcException - this is a dependency in pom.xml and should be downloaded when you run maven install.
It sure sounds like your local maven repo does not have all of the prereqs. Can you do this.
- indicate which classes you had the @Override issues for - Do the following
a. right click the bugzilla pom.xml -> Run As -> maven clean b. right click the bugzilla pom.xml -> Run As -> maven install
Look for any errors early in the maven install on not being able to download files
Go to your .m2 directory - I think in Windows it is under Documents and Settings for your user. Go to .m2/repository/org/apache/xmlrpc/xmlrpc-client/3.1.3 and make sure there is a jar file there.
Somehow you are missing dependencies and that is what we need to figure out.

I got it working now.
1. @Override errors are still there, but it compiles and starts.
2. tag library errors are also there, but it compiles and starts.
3. In pom.xml for org.eclipse.lyo.samples.bugzilla I changed the dependency org.apache.geronimo.specs from 'Scope:' 'provided' to 'compile'.
So I got a new error for xmlrpc-common something that the hash for the file is incorrect. So I donwloaded xmlrpc-common-3.1.3.jar from http://grepcode.com/snapshot/repo1.maven.org/maven2/org.apache.xmlrpc/xmlrpc-common/3.1.3
and copied it to C:\Users\stefanpaschke\.m2\repository\org\apache\xmlrpc\xmlrpc-common\3.1.3 overwriting the existing file
I did the same for xmlrpc-client and downloaded xmlrpc-client-3.1.3.jar from http://grepcode.com/snapshot/repo1.maven.org/maven2/org.apache.xmlrpc/xmlrpc-client/3.1.3
and copied it to C:\Users\stefanpaschke\.m2\repository\org\apache\xmlrpc\xmlrpc-client\3.1.3 overwriting the existing file
Everthing works fine now. After a maven clean and maven install. Ah the user that you are providing in the source is not valid anymore. I had to register my own at https://landfill.bugzilla.org.

Glad it is working.
I delivered a change on Friday for the taglib/jstl errors - if you pull the latest they should go away.
Sounds like there was a glitch downloading some of the maven dependencies. Good idea to overwrite them.

attachment.desc: Errors mentioned in text and maven sure fire (test) reports

bug.short_desc: Not able to parse RDF Turtle payloads in a POST/PUT request

long_desc.thetext:
When an RDF Turtle payload is submitted in a POST/PUT request, the following error is always received:
"org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Content is not allowed in prolog."
Looking in the OSLC4J source code, the method "readFrom" from AbstractOslcRdfXmlProvider class is called. In this method, the comparison that is being done in the if statement will never be true. So it's always taking the default reader, which handles xml and abbreviated xml.
Trying to set the Turtle Reader manually in the debug mode, everything works fine. A possible solution for this problem might be the use of the "isCompatible" method instead of the "equals" method in the if comparison.

Resolved by
https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/14977/
Fixed in Lyo 2.0.

bug.short_desc: Jazzbased formlogin - invalid credentials does not give expected result

long_desc.thetext:
Taking a bit different approach
- if we find the Jazz-specific X-com-ibm-team-repository-web-auth-msg, use the value there to determine auth failed - status code will be 200 here. For this failure throw a JazzAuthFailureException
- then check the status code. if something other than 200 or 302, throw a JazzAuthErrorException with the status code
Added a message bundle and some structured exception handling as well.
Update the samples to use the new exceptions.
If you have your own samples, they will need the new package name for the exceptions.
Additionally, updated pom.xml to get rid of the exceptions related to the missing annotation classes.

bug.short_desc: QM tests fail if optional properties are missing

long_desc.thetext:
In several places in the QM tests, we check that there is exactly one value for zero-or-one properties. We should not fail in these cases. One example is
TestResultHasOneProducedByTestExecutionRecord
which is a zero-or-one property, but there are others.
https://git.eclipse.org/r/36843
This bug was filed against 2.1.0 (not 3.0.0) and the fix was likely released in 2.1.2.

bug.short_desc: Throw an exception when a 404 response was received

long_desc.thetext:
Currently client silently proceeds to the unmarshalling, where this message gets thrown from Wink because we try to feed it with the content of the 404 message:
A javax.ws.rs.ext.MessageBodyReader implementation was not found for class sandbox.resources.Waypoint type and application/octet-stream media type.
I would love to see that fixed.

bug.short_desc: RmUtil return Resource Shape where XSD:int(http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#int) is null.

long_desc.thetext:
Hi Yajuvendra,
I don't understant your report, sorry. Could you please elaborate what exactly is that you are doing and how does the error manifest?
/Andrew

Hi Andrew I am trying to evaluate all the properties of Resource Shape. Function attrProperty.getValueType() is returning URI of Type[oslc:valueType](Refer sample of Resource Shape). When I have type URI defined as "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#int" in Resource Shape, function getValueType() is returning NULL. It is working fine for other Type like "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string".
Let me know if you have any specific question.

Right, now I see.
Could you be missing a full name of the datatype? https://www.w3.org/TR/2012/REC-xmlschema11-2-20120405/datatypes.html#integer
See https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.core/blob/6daebbe444501e409a4185bcee6e7d9674b18df8/org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/lyo/oslc4j/core/model/Property.java#L220

And we indeed could support the XML datatypes more fully!
For anyone interested, https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15336872/xsd-what-is-the-difference-between-xsinteger-and-xsint
See http://docs.oasis-open.org/oslc-core/oslc-core/v3.0/oslc-core-v3.0-part6-resource-shape.html, OSLC Core only supports xsd:integer, not xsd:int.
See Bug 534343
FYI https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.core/blob/master/org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/lyo/oslc4j/core/model/ValueType.java#L30

(In reply to Jim Amsden from comment #5) > See > http://docs.oasis-open.org/oslc-core/oslc-core/v3.0/oslc-core-v3.0-part6- > resource-shape.html, OSLC Core only supports xsd:integer, not xsd:int.
Just for the record, Lyo core only seems to support xsd:int in order to map Java ints faithfully, but not the xsd:integer mandated by the soec.
(In reply to Yajuvendra Singh Sankhala from comment #2) > Hi Andrew > I am trying to evaluate all the properties of Resource Shape. > Function attrProperty.getValueType() is returning URI of > Type[oslc:valueType](Refer sample of Resource Shape). > When I have type URI defined as "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#int" in > Resource Shape, function getValueType() is returning NULL. > It is working fine for other Type like > "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string". > > Let me know if you have any specific question.
Thank you, Yajuvendra! It seems that while the Lyo framework supports xsd:int <> Java int mapping, the value types are limited to the legit values as mandated by the spec: https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.core/blob/6daebbe444501e409a4185bcee6e7d9674b18df8/org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/lyo/oslc4j/core/model/Property.java#L236
Yajuvendra, did you find a workaround for your problem? Because I think this issue will be solved in Bug 534676 unless someone has time to make a patch earlier than that.

And just to confirm, Yajuvendra, http://jtsserver in your sample stands for the Jazz Team Server?
Jim, if so, we might consider adding xsd:int to the list of Lyo contants in order to handle the corner cases from IBM & other tools (cough, other Lyo adapters themselves, which have been producing xsd:int's since the very beginning).
Yes It is Jazz Team Server.
Jim, please decide what to do

bug.short_desc: rdf:Seq deserialization in JMH contains no elements

long_desc.thetext:
JMH deserialization code for rdf:Seq properties assumes that elements in such container are stored as RDFS.member:
https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.core/blob/master/org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.provider.jena/src/main/java/org/eclipse/lyo/oslc4j/provider/jena/JenaModelHelper.java#L670
However this is not the case for rdf:Seq elements which are stored as:
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#_1 http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#_2 http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#_3 ...
As elements in a sequence are not members (from the perspective of the predicate) the container is always deserialized empty.
Since each rdf container implementation (bag, alt, seq) has it own politic about the order of the elements, getting them by just listing a certain type of statements does not warranties the order of the underlying container will be respected. A safer way to obtain the elements in the proper container is to cast the Resource instance to the particular Container implementation:
Container container = object.as(containerImpl); NodeIterator iterator = container.iterator();
Thanks, let's take it on the mailing list with Jim and others. RDF collections support was discussed before with results close to wontfix.

This test data should be created by the TRS > provider and provided to the TRS consume in an integrated test suite. The > actual persistent store should therefore be part of .gitignore.

bug.short_desc: Multi-typed resource collections only show one type for abbreviated RDF/XML serialization

long_desc.thetext:
A resource collection has two types - one is declared in @OslcName(... - second is added via the AbstractResource#addType method
Using the Jena application/rdf+xml serialization, both types are present, so the POJOs and constructed RDF graph are ok.
Using the OSLC4J custom abbreviated application/xml serialization, only the type added via addType is present in the XML. There should be an <rdf:type> predicate in the abbreviated XML for the additional type.

This has never worked for the RdfXmlAbbreviatedWriter in OSLC4J - it explicitly excludes rdf:type from the predicates serialized and only uses it on elements. In effect it takes the first statement with a predicate of rdf:type which Jena gives it and makes that the type on the element. Other rdf:type predicates on the same resource are ignored.
The preferred approach is to request/provide application/rdf+xml instead of application/xml.
I wrote all this code, and have the rights to contribute it to Eclipse and contribute it under the EPL and EDL

Resolved by commit:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=bc314acfdd2ca79ff37b24abe5370345106213d1

bug.short_desc: Jar files inconsistent to source code seen in the git repositories

long_desc.thetext:
The org.ecliose.lyo.oslc4j-1.1 download contains jar files containing the source code. However by observation it looks like the jar files are out of date compared to the source code seen through the web site.
For example within org.eclipse.lyo.client repository:
Requirement.java, RequirementCollection.java, RmConstants.java, and RmUtil.java are classes that appear in the source code online, and are used in the sample code provided (RRCFormSample.java to be precise), but do not appear in the jar files. They also do not appear in the documentation provided by the oslc4j-1.1 download.
Another issue found was that in the OSLCClient.java class the method below exists in the online source code but not in the jar files.
public ClientResponse updateResource(String url, final Object artifact, String mediaType, String acceptType, String ifMatch)
Another issue occurs when trying to download org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j-oauth-libs-1.1.zip, the file does not seem to be available.
Would it be possible to update the jar files to contain these files, and update the downloads page to reflect the org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j-oauth-libs-1.1.zip doesn't exist or make the files available?
Thanks Heather

Hi, Heather. The source files in the 1.1 download were for the 1.1 release. What's on the website is the 2.0 stream, which is more current. It's why things don't match. For instance, Requirement.java was added after the 1.1 release in this bug:
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=406799
We have added the latest source JARs to the maven.eclipse.org repository. If you're using Maven to build, you can add this dependency
<project> ... <repositories> <repository> <id>lyo-snapshots</id> <url>https://repo.eclipse.org/content/repositories/lyo-snapshots/</url> </repository> </repositories> ... </project>
You should be able to point to 2.0.0-SNAPSHOT versions of your Lyo libraries and use the following commands to download the sources and Javadocs.
mvn dependency:sources mvn dependency:resolve -Dclassifier=javadoc
Alternately, you can follow the steps here to build and run the client code locally:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo/BuildClient
I'll open a separate defect for the bad OAuth library downloads. In the meantime, you can load the OAuth code as follows:
- In the Git Repositories view, right click org.eclipse.lyo.server and select Import Projects - Select the Import Existing Projects wizard and click Next - Import the following projects: org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.consumerstore org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.core org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.webapp - Run Maven Install on each project in this order, org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.core org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.consumerstore org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.webapp
Let me know if you have problems.

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.wink log4j.properties file getting picked up instead of the project's

long_desc.thetext:
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.wink is the only non-executable/sample project in eclipse/lyo that has a log4j.properties file, and it only contains a the following configuration: log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
If you attempt to put a log4j.properties file with proper rootLogger and appenders in your project's src/main/resources folder, log4j will pickup the wink file instead and give the warnings that there are no appenders defined.
Should this file be removed? Note that doing so does allow the application's log4j.properties file to be properly loaded, and the logging works as expected.

Yes, absolutely (though it should be just moved under /src/test/resources). Also, more projects have the log4j file:
ack log4j.logger org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.registry/src/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.registry/target/oslc4j-registry-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.stockquote/src/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.stockquote/target/classes/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.stockquote/target/m2e-wtp/web-resources/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.test/src/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.test/target/classes/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.test/target/m2e-wtp/web-resources/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.wink/src/log4j.properties 19:log4j.logger.org.apache.wink=WARN
***
The reason it creates problem is that it is part of the "main" build:
<module>../org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.wink</module> (fron org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.build/pom.xml)
oslc4j-wink is shipped as part of the TRS module:
ack "<artifactId>oslc4j-wink</artifactId>" org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs/pom.xml 24: <artifactId>oslc4j-wink</artifactId>
***
To summarise: I submit a patch removing this file today to include it in the release!
New Gerrit change created: https://git.eclipse.org/r/101586
Gerrit change https://git.eclipse.org/r/101586 was merged to [master]. Commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.core.git/commit/?id=bcf09668f1f3b345a0d99c4e04ff350478e1f522

bug.short_desc: No parallel execution of REST calls with OSLC client

long_desc.thetext: The actual implementation of OSLC client does not allow to use it within multi-threaded execution. This is a show stopper when you use the lyo project in a productive environment and need to - for instance - fetch thousands of requirements at the same time. Only sequential executions possible.

Discussion on the mailing list:
http://dev.eclipse.org/mhonarc/lists/lyo-dev/msg00628.html

I modified the original code a little bit. I initialized the DefaultHttpClient with ThreadSafeClientConnManager and did no further changes. The get*, update*, create* and delete* methods are already thread-safe.
So far, I only tested the get* operation in multi-threaded environment. Are there other circumstances to check?

(In reply to Benjamin Roehl from comment #2)
Benjamin, this sounds good to me. Is it something you'd consider contributing to the project?

(In reply to Samuel Padgett from comment #3)
I can do this of course. Are there any things to consider?

(In reply to Benjamin Roehl from comment #4)
Great! Here is some information about contributing:
https://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo/ContributorsGettingStarted
Let me know if you have any trouble.
It's a good change. It add important functionality without much code churn. If we upgrade to the newest Apache HTTP client, we might look at moving to PoolingHttpClientConnectionManager, but I think this is the right thing with version 4.1.
Do we need to expose a way to set connection limits like concurrent and total connections?
Thanks, Benjamin.

(In reply to Samuel Padgett from comment #5)
Regarding your last question I don't think it is necessary. Since you're able to get the used Http Client, you also can get it's connection manager. That allows you to set the maximum connections and so on. Furthermore you can manage the closing of idle or expired connections.
Thanks again! I've integrated the change.
Resolving as fixed.
Will be released in 2.1.2.

bug.short_desc: returned trs base resources do not refer to members as ldp:member

long_desc.thetext:
How to see the bug?
Start a rest client Navigate to a base representation provided using Lyo
What did you expect?
According to the TRS specification: Each Resource in the Resource Set MUST be referenced from the container using an LDP membership predicate. the members of the base were expected to be referenced to as the objects of ldp:member predicates
What did happen instead?
The base members are referred to as rdfs:member predicate
Omar, could you also clarify if this one is a blocker for Bug 513207, please?
Just stumbled on it. Omar, can you still remember any details about this one, please?
Cleaning up "3.0.0" bugs.
I think the code in the patch works with this limitation; the TRS 3.0 spec might change this and therefore no action will be done here.

bug.short_desc: JenaModelHelper throws OslcCoreMisusedOccursException on properties with multiple lang triples

long_desc.thetext:
fromJenaModel in org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.provider.jena.JenaModelHelper fails on reading resources that have multiple instances of a string property, each tagged with a different language tag, if the property definition in the shape for that resource says the occurrence is zero or one, or exactly one.
This constraint is contrary to the decision made in the OASIS OSLC Core TC, where we agreed to treat multiple instances each with a different language tag (plus possibly one occurrence with no language tag) as acceptable with a maximum occurrence of one.
To reproduce this problem, try reading the resource shapes for the RQM test plan creation factory in recent releases of RQM (including 6.0.4 currently on jazz.net). The dcterms:title property of those shapes have multiple occurrences for different languages.
The result is that fromJenaModel will throw a OslcCoreMisusedOccursException. It ought instead to instantiate the shape either for a specific language (see bug 398142), or with the multiple string titles in a new language-tagged string type.

Thank you for the report Nick.
We will need to cover this with unit tests as we don't have IBM infra at Eclipse or KTH.
Also, is this part of the OSLC 2 spec? I think for now the OSLC 3 effort is a separate one that we have not been actively working on lately.
Jad has been rethinking the approach around shapes recently and, so maybe he could suggest concrete opinion on how we shall handle this.
Finally, I was preparing to refactor the Jena Model helper for a while now, so maybe we can finally start improving it.

This is left unspecified in the OSLC 2.0 spec. I think we may need to think about the implications of the OSLC Core 3.0 TC recommendation. Consider a single valued string property. There are two contexts in which we need to deal with cardinality and language tags: in the repository, and during any specific use of the property.
Given the AAA principle and the fact that the same repository could be used to support multiple languages, there may certainly be multiple assertions involving this property.
However, when the property is used in a context where the constraints are applied, there should only be one value for the property in local associated with that context. The question is when is that constraint applied, and do we consider local for the purpose of applying the constraint?
I think we should use local when applying constraints. In that case, I would expect the JenaModelHelper to fail only if it gets multiple values for the property with the same language tag.

JenaModelHelper does not "understand" language tags, it simply iterates over the RDFNode instances in the model. fromResource is 500-line beast and we should break it up before adding language support.

bug.short_desc: Logging libraries are used inconsistently

long_desc.thetext:
In order to achieve maven dependency convergence and resolve classloader warnings regarding the duplicate implementations on the classpath, we need:
* Use the same library (now we have projects that use SLF4j and some depend on Log4j directly). Recommendation: use only SLF4j. * Use the logging library *implementation* (i.e. Log4j, logback etc.) only in the applications that can be run on in tests. Recommendation: replace most of the pom dependencies to slf4j-* with slf4j-api.
If we don't fix it, this is how a clean logging needs to be setup (example of using a client library that itself uses core):
<dependency> <groupId>org.eclipse.lyo.clients</groupId> <artifactId>oslc-java-client</artifactId> <version>2.1.2-SNAPSHOT</version> <exclusions> <exclusion> <groupId>log4j</groupId> <artifactId>log4j</artifactId> </exclusion> <exclusion> <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId> <artifactId>slf4j-log4j12</artifactId> </exclusion> <exclusion> <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId> <artifactId>jcl-over-slf4j</artifactId> </exclusion> </exclusions> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId> <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId> <version>1.7.21</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId> <artifactId>slf4j-simple</artifactId> <version>1.7.21</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency>

bug.short_desc: AutomationPlan's ParameterDefinition rdf is wrongly generated

long_desc.thetext:
AutomationPlans' addParameterDefinition uses Property as input parameter, generated rdf looks like following:
<j.0:parameterDefinition> <oslc:Property> <oslc:allowedValue>ONE</oslc:allowedValue> <oslc:allowedValue>TWO</oslc:allowedValue> <oslc:valueType rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string"/> <oslc:propertyDefinition rdf:resource="http://open-services.net/ns/auto#ParameterDefinition"/> <oslc:occurs rdf:resource="http://open-services.net/ns/core#Exactly-one"/> <oslc:name>Sample name</oslc:name> <dcterms:description rdf:parseType="Literal">Sample description</dcterms:description> </oslc:Property> </j.0:parameterDefinition>
I got following comment to this during code/scenario review:
"The triple oslc:propertyDefinition should be omitted entirely. Its presence would asserts that the subject shape contains constraints about the usage of oslc_auto:parameterDefinition in your implementation, but this shape contains constraints about *your parameter* on *your Auto Plan*. Since Automation Plan parameters are not namespace-qualified, oslc:propertyDefinition is omitted for them. There is 1 line in the Automation 2.0 spec about this ;-) and the currently available 2.0 examples DO have this triple, but should not, and I have queued a correction up in the Automation WG."
Specs' samples seem to be updated already.

bug.short_desc: Investigate possible test suite bug when ServiceProviderCatalog contains ref to serviceProvider resource

long_desc.thetext:
Build Identifier:
Investigate a possible regression in the test suite.
Trying to get CM tests to run well against the ref implementation and hitting an issue. Might have to discuss directly, but am documenting it here for followup.
For RTC, the serviceProvider entry in the ServiceProviderCatalog looks like this:
<oslc:serviceProvider> <oslc:ServiceProvider rdf:about="https://rqmx64e.rtp.raleigh.ibm.com:9443/ccm/oslc/contexts/_GhH_MtlrEeCqjb8y_rUpVQ/workitems/services.xml"> <dcterms:title rdf:parseType="Literal">JKE Banking (Change Management)</dcterms:title> <oslc:details rdf:resource="https://rqmx64e.rtp.raleigh.ibm.com:9443/ccm/process/project-areas/_GhH_MtlrEeCqjb8y_rUpVQ"/> <ns1:consumerRegistry rdf:resource="https://rqmx64e.rtp.raleigh.ibm.com:9443/ccm/process/project-areas/_GhH_MtlrEeCqjb8y_rUpVQ/links"/> </oslc:ServiceProvider> </oslc:serviceProvider>
The ServiceProvider about URI points to a document with a toplevel oslc:ServiceProvider element which contains multiple oslc:service entries.
For the CM ref implementation the entry in the ServiceProviderCatalog looks like this:
<oslc:serviceProvider rdf:resource="http://localhost:8080/rio-cm/services"/>
This points to a document with a toplevel oslc:ServiceProvider element which contains an oslc:service entry.
The CM testcases are not running well against the ref implementation because they expect the catalog to contain a ServiceProvider entry with an about property. The ref implementation contains the rdf:resource entry instead.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start CM RIO 2. Run the Test-CM RIO test suite
Several tests will fail to run due to the inability to get the ServiceProvider document.
I just happened onto this bug and looking at a fix, taking ownership

Fixed also ServiceProviderCatalog as it has similar issue http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.testsuite.git/commit/?id=a4f0f911ff3e2f5e04972f580bccad1c0e1a2dcf
http://git.eclipse.org/c/lyo/org.eclipse.lyo.testsuite.git/commit/?id=544ccd8ac6ee5a9637a9182ce06bd6d774677a2f
verified

bug.short_desc: Add experimental TRS MQTT implementation

long_desc.thetext:
As the number or TRS servers grows, a push mechanism is needed to prevent latency increase.
Xufei (CC) has implemented an initial MQTT implementation on top of the TRS Server library (which was called TRS Provider in development) and Client application (called TRS Consumer in development), both of which were implemented by Omar (CC).
Omar's contribution is tracked in Bug 513207, this will be the bug to track Xufei's contribution.

Current status of the contribution:
* awaiting for Bug 513207 * I am preparing a patch on the new project layout that differs from the internal repo, where the development was done
Xufei, you have signed the ECA, right?

There may be other uses of MQTT for OSLC, including as a mechanism for doing common event processing as a standard means of behavioral integration, a capability currently missing in OSLC. This broader view of data, UI and behavioral integration capabilities should be considered with TRS. For example, TRS is a traditional data mining approach to put data from multiple sources into a single repository, perhaps with a different, integrated schema, in order to support new application capabilities. If OSLC had behavioral integration, perhaps there would be less need to mine and replicate this data.

(In reply to Jim Amsden from comment #2) > There may be other uses of MQTT for OSLC, including as a mechanism for doing > common event processing as a standard means of behavioral integration, a > capability currently missing in OSLC. This broader view of data, UI and > behavioral integration capabilities should be considered with TRS. For > example, TRS is a traditional data mining approach to put data from multiple > sources into a single repository, perhaps with a different, integrated > schema, in order to support new application capabilities. If OSLC had > behavioral integration, perhaps there would be less need to mine and > replicate this data.
Absolutely! I have yet to master all of it, but I got really inspired by the messaging approach from the EIP book: http://www.enterpriseintegrationpatterns.com/patterns/messaging/

Behavioral integration: is that for example to support things such as notifications (to humans via email for example), triggering some workflow activity, etc? We've had requests for such activities, so it would certainly be interesting to integrate into OSLC.
Done in https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.trs-client/tree/master/client-source-mqtt

bug.short_desc: Consumer Secret OAuth passwords saved in base64

long_desc.thetext:
The password "OAuth / Consumer Secret" is saved in base64 in the XML file "CE4IoTConnectorOAuthStore.xml" in VM.
Anyone with access to the VM and XML file can read the value of the password and determine that the value has been base 64 encoded, then get its decoded value with the use of online tools available on Internet to decode/encode base 64.
Fix for this issue:
oauth-consumer-store-2.3.0.jar is responsible for storing the consumer key's and secrets. Class 'org.eclipse.lyo.server.oauth.consumerstore.FileSystemConsumerStore' is using base64 encoding to store the consumer secret
Line:221 String encodedSecret = new String(Base64.encodeBase64(consumer.consumerSecret.getBytes("UTF8")),"UTF8");
I can make changes to enhance the plain base64 to keyed base64 encoding.

Thanks Rahul for spotting this! I agree, base64 encoding does not do anything to improve the security.
What is a "keyed base64 encoding"? And what is the threat vector here? I think if an attacked gets inside our VM, it's a game over?
I know that 12FA apps (https://12factor.net/) advocate for env vars. The advantage is that the password does not end up in a WAR file.

Hi Andrew,
I mean by "keyed base64 encoding" is, we can encrypt the text with a secret key using AES and encode it with base64. The key used here have to be provided and managed by consumers.
We can add that provision by just overloading the existing constructor with an additional parameter for key. So the key/password will be managed by the user and they can store it in code or anywhere else as per their policies.
What you think ? In between, I will also go through 12FA.
Regards, Rahul

Hi Rahul, I am 100% in support of an overloaded ctor. Please open a pull request to https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.server and assign me and Jim as reviewers, please. Adding it to the 2.4.0 milestone provisionally here.
I have submitted a pull request with the suggested changes.

How will the user provide this key? There's currently no UI in the oslc-server, or in the simple admin UI generated by Lyo Designer to manage these keys. Seems like this will be needed in order to provide a complete implementation.
I approved the PR but you need to fix the Git commit email address and force-push the amended commit.
Hi Andrew,Jim, What is the timeline to publish 2.4.0 version ? Are the 2.4.0 SNAPSHOT versions available in maven repo to test in Dev Env ?

Hi, If anybody knows about 2.4.0 release which will include this fix, please let me know the timeline.
There is an adoption item waiting for this fix.
Thanks , Rahul

(In reply to Rahul Singh from comment #9) > Hi, > If anybody knows about 2.4.0 release which will include this fix, please let > me know the timeline. > > There is an adoption item waiting for this fix. > > Thanks , > Rahul
Hi Rahul,
we are awaiting some IP checks from Eclipse and want to merge some SHACL related functionality. I would pessimistically expect 2.4.0 to be released late August early September. Can you use 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT in the meanwhile?
/A

Hi Andrew, Thanks for quick response.
Is the 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT version available on maven repo ? Can I ship my connector with 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT without any legal issues ?
2.4.0-SNAPSHOT is available from maven. There are no legal issues there, because we check all IP before merging to master. However, Eclipse only guarantees the IP provenance in the final releases.

but you'll have to use the following repositories in your pom.xml file
<repositories> <repository> <id>lyo-snapshots</id> <name>lyo-snapshots repository</name> <url>https://repo.eclipse.org/content/repositories/lyo-snapshots/</url> </repository> </repositories>
See https://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo/creating_OSLC4J_project#Lyo_repositories
Rahul, ready to review a patch if you can submit one.

(In reply to Andrii Berezovskyi from comment #14) > Rahul, ready to review a patch if you can submit one.
Sure, I am waiting for Lyo 2.4.0 release which will include this changes to Adopt in my Connector.

bug.short_desc: Override all OslcClient#getResource(...) in OslcOAuthClient

long_desc.thetext:
OslcOAuthClient does not override all getResource(...) methods declared by OslcClient.
Hence, if an instance of OslcOAuthClient is used and getResource(String url) or getResource(String url, Map<String, String> requestHeaders) is called, OAuth is not handled.

Thank you for the report, Patrick.
You are right, but the intention was to override only the method that gets called in the end. The following method should have been overridden:
https://github.com/eclipse/lyo.client/blob/92477b911510e1783bac63d442c731988fd2a48d/org.eclipse.lyo.client.java/src/main/java/org/eclipse/lyo/client/oslc/OslcClient.java#L229

/Andrew

long_desc.thetext:

This is a problem since developers with fresh workspaces will not have these in their local Maven repository, and we don't host 1.0 or 1.1 yet in a public repository. There is no way to build without downloaded the JARs and manually installing them.

bug.short_desc: Lyo Client Doesn't Handle String List Attributes

long_desc.thetext:
Found In: Lyo client 2.1.1 [Note: 2.1.1 is not a value in the Version list above]
Environment RTC 6.0.1 Lyo client 2.1.1
To Reproduce
1. Create and add an attribute of type String List to work items 2. Create a work item 3. Set a value to the String List-type attribute 4. Use Lyo client make a change to the work item
Expected: JazzFormAuthClient.updateResource() is successful
Actual: Status code in ClientResponse (returned by JazzFormAuthClient.updateResource()) is 500; Message is "Internal Server Error"
RTC server log contains the following: Failed to serve the request - 'resource/itemName/com.ibm.team.workitem.WorkItem/<work item #>'.Reason - 'Illegal JSON Array: [<values set in String List attribute>]'.

I haven't yet figured out how to get the complete XML of the work item sent to RTC, but I do have:
1. The XML of work item Entity returned by RTC to the Lyo client (prior to Lyo making any changes). The element in that XML of the the String List attribute that contains a value (2 values this case) is:
<rtc_ext:environment rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string">[1607 FIE - OMS1BT01, 1607 FIE - OMS2BT01]</rtc_ext:environment>
2. The XML of the complaint from RTC returned to the Lyo client when it PUT the work item back:
<oslc:message>Illegal JSON Array: [1607 FIE - OMS1BT01, 1607 FIE - OMS2BT01]</oslc:message>
This bug can be closed. Issue is a bug in RTC: https://jazz.net/jazz/web/projects/Rational%20Team%20Concert#action=com.ibm.team.workitem.viewWorkItem&id=409901
Oh do I hate when this happens :-). Thanks for the update.

bug.short_desc: The toolchain tree cannot be expanded if a specification is present

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 271035 empty toolchain EMF object tree
Please see the screenshot attached. Opening and closing the project does not help.

1. Right click on toolchain.xml file and "open with-> toolchain Editor" (or somethign like that to handle the model as an EMF model). How does the model look like? Do you have adaptors and/or specs to view? I suspect you may have an empty model, and hence nothign to show.
2. Can you right click on the "Toolchain new toolchain" entry and do "create representation"? Will that work?
3. I suspect you have problems with the aird file (which is where the graphical data is stored). From my experiences, you can only have 1 aird file per project. And I also managed to have 2 models within the 1 project (and hence usig the 1 aird file).
But maybe having 2 model is not a stable solution, and hence causes problems. Worth trying further until we know better.

(In reply to Jad El-khoury from comment #1) > 1. Right click on toolchain.xml file and "open with-> toolchain Editor" (or > somethign like that to handle the model as an EMF model). How does the model > look like? Do you have adaptors and/or specs to view? > I suspect you may have an empty model, and hence nothign to show.
Yes, there is only a single Toolchain node "New ToolChain".
> 2. Can you right click on the "Toolchain new toolchain" entry and do "create > representation"? Will that work?
Very confusing that this dialog only appears on the node as shown in the Project Explorer but not the Toolchain Editor. I was able to create the Toolchain representation, it created a Toolchain diagram and a Specification node. Creating a representation for it, I was able to get all the way through and create the toolchain, specification and an adaptor.
However, when I tried to do magic trickery, and remove the root Specification from the Toolchain element and instead load the specification file that I created according to your standalone domain spec instructions, it stopped working. Now when I try to create an adaptor, I can only select an EObject domain spec :)
Afterwards I decided not to delete a Specification node from the Toolchain but drag the domains from the standalone specification to the newly created diagram. It worked fine but I was unable to select the domain I dragged into the new diagram when creating an adaptor. So that has to be solved if we are to allow extracting all of the domains into a separate file.
Can you please explain how did you envision using the standalone Specification feature? Did you only cover the scenario where the domain is shared across the teams within an enterprise and the standalone spec is always located in another modelling project?
> 3. I suspect you have problems with the aird file (which is where the > graphical data is stored). > From my experiences, you can only have 1 aird file per project. And I also > managed to have 2 models within the 1 project (and hence usig the 1 aird > file).
Sirius doc: https://www.eclipse.org/sirius/doc/user/general/Modeling%20Project.html#MPConstraints
"A top-level representations file is a file that stores representations. Such files can be modularized, which means they can be split in several files, but there is always one master file which references the others and is referenced by none. This file is the top-level file, and there can be only one per modeling project. To say this differently: If you want to have several independent representations files, each of them must be placed in its own modeling project."
> But maybe having 2 model is not a stable solution, and hence causes > problems. > Worth trying further until we know better.
As I understand, as long as we store the Sirius info for the diagrams from different models separately (so IDs have to be globally unique), it should be fine: https://www.eclipse.org/sirius/doc/user/general/Modeling%20Project.html#AirdStructure

This calls for a live screen-sharing to debug.
Admittedly, it is not 100% clear how Lyo Designer allows you to do some of these modelling activities. Partly because of inheritance from Sirius, and partly because I am not yet supporting all possible ways you can drag-drop things around.
But given that you have read my nice instructions, and are still confused, it's a perfect case to see how we can clarify things.
tell me when!

bug.short_desc: Problems with ResolveURITest in oslc4j.core

long_desc.thetext:
The following test is incorrect:
org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.core.test.ResolveURITest.testDisableHostResolution()
Even though we clear the public URI root system property, OSLC4JUtils caches the public URI root value. It's using the cached value instead of a calculated value, so we're not really testing the disable host resolution property. In fact, if the tests are run in a different order, the test actually fails because it has other problems. For instance, the scheme is set to https, but the assert uses http.
https://git.eclipse.org/r/17844

bug.short_desc: Architecture resource and link type resources not possible to unmarshall

long_desc.thetext:
These both resource types are not unmarshalled, since the wrong qualified resource name is computed for each. The Unmarshaller (to be more specific, the TypeFactory.getQualifiedName(Object)) uses the Java class name, since the OslcName annotation is not found. Thus the 'ArchitecureResource' and 'ArchitectureLinkType' is used as qualified name.
Solution: Introduce @OslcName annotation to both Java classes defining these resource types.
If you like I can push the appropriate fix to gerrit.
Sounds good to me.

(In reply to Benjamin Roehl from comment #1) > If you like I can push the appropriate fix to gerrit.

when I get some time to work on 2.2.0.

bug.short_desc: Cross Site scripting issues in generated OSLC selection and creation dialogs

long_desc.thetext:
IBM App Scan reports number of Cross Site scripting issues in the generated selection and creation dialogs by Lyo Code generator.
Request with XSS in query parameters: GET /iotp/com/ibm/oslc/adaptor/iotp/creationdialogsampleclient.jsp?creationUri=<script>alert(873) </script> HTTP/1.1 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko Referer: https://localhost:9443/iotp/services/iotp/rhu3zv Cookie: JSESSIONID=0000ppLLh2whAvjaBLdmJWVYeNZ:beef33de-543d-4d79-8044-088558f82fb8 Host: brd10637.persistent.co.in:9443 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en-US
Response of the above request includes XSS injected in JSP page.
Affected JSPs: https://localhost:9443/iotp/com/ibm/oslc/adaptor/iotp/selectiondialogsampleclient.jsp https://localhost:9443/iotp/com/ibm/oslc/adaptor/iotp/creationdialogsampleclient.jsp https://localhost:9443/iotp/services/bmx/4dfeca77-98e0-49ba-b5d6-23fe67d4b436/resources/selector

Created attachment 273252 validation file for URI sanitization used in delegated dialog URIs
This is the validator file we have been using in util package to sanitize the delegated dialog URIs in several JSPs while rendering the selection and creation jsps.
Thank you, Rahul! Same here: could you please submit a patch via Gerrit?

Thanks Rahul! Andrii! Since this touches the generator templates, I think it easier if I simply do the coding. I will not be able to test it, but trust that the code already works. I hope Rahul can validate that it is working.

Hi Jad, Let me know once you are done with the changes. Jim and I will re-generate the dialog's and I will verify it running the IBM App Scan again.
Thanks, Rahul

Hi Rahul
I got the basics of this bug fix in place. But to avoid the IP issues raised on https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/120164/, can you also please confirm or deal with the source of this code, before I push to gerrit?

Thank you, Rahul.
After a closer look, we should indeed fix this issue. However, I am not sure we should write some code (untested, BTW) to do this.
I suggest we check if the parameter indeed holds a URI via https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/UrlValidator.html and if not, we just throw a web exception https://dennis-xlc.gitbooks.io/restful-java-with-jax-rs-2-0-en/cn/part1/chapter7/exception_handling.html with the code https://httpstatuses.com/400
On top of that, I would rather do these checks not in the JSP but in the controller method before we render the page.
Rahul, I won't have time to implement it in the following days, could you please try in on your adaptor? I can then modify your code into the templates for the code generator.

(In reply to Andrii Berezovskyi from comment #7) > Thank you, Rahul. > > After a closer look, we should indeed fix this issue. However, I am not sure > we should write some code (untested, BTW) to do this. > > I suggest we check if the parameter indeed holds a URI via > https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/ > commons/validator/routines/UrlValidator.html and if not, we just throw a web > exception > https://dennis-xlc.gitbooks.io/restful-java-with-jax-rs-2-0-en/cn/part1/ > chapter7/exception_handling.html with the code https://httpstatuses.com/400 > > On top of that, I would rather do these checks not in the JSP but in the > controller method before we render the page. > > Rahul, I won't have time to implement it in the following days, could you > please try in on your adaptor? I can then modify your code into the > templates for the code generator.
Hi Andrew,
I have the proposed code changes in my adapter workspace and it works.
Throwing exception doesn't seems good idea to me as hackers always try to break or steal the functionality by injecting malicious code. Sanitizing those malicious inputs and path parameters are the recommended way to handle this.
I agree that we can do these checks in controller instead of JSP. Let me try that. Will update you.

Hello Rahul,
I don't believe in security through obscurity. If the input is considered to contain XSS, we will return a 4XX code indicating that the input will not be accepted. We will not be serving a page with the sanitized outputs (the best practice you refer to is to sanitize the inputs, not outputs).
For the record, there is a special exception https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/api/javax/ws/rs/WebApplicationException.html that is intended to return a error code, as opposed to showing a stack trace (which may indeed help an attacker). However, you are free to do it the clean way in the controller via a Response object https://dennis-xlc.gitbooks.io/restful-java-with-jax-rs-2-0-en/cn/part1/chapter7/complex_responses.html
/Andrew

Hi Rahul & Andrii
Have you settled on a solution for this? We don't have to have the perfect solution.
i am happy to code the generator, once i get sample java code

bug.short_desc: retrieving an entity of type TRS from the server response fails

long_desc.thetext: The JenaModelHelper crashes in line 819 when i try to retrieve the TRS entity from a server response. The bug seems to be caused when the fromResource method tries to instantiate abstract classes in this case the tracked resource set class has an attribute change log which is an abstract class. Hence, the method fails to create an instance of this class. A temporary fix on my side consists on making the changeLog attribute of the tracked resource set class of type ChangeLog and hence eliminating the problem of trying to instantiate the abstract class given that changeLog is not abstract. The same problem happens with the changeEvent class in the changeLog class which is abstract.

Let me give a bug summary:
TrackedResourceSet has changeLog:AbstractChangeLog field. Any attempt to unmarshall a previously marshalled instance of a TrackedResourceSet class fail. This is because JenaModelHelper blindly tried to instantiate an instance and populate each field that has OSLC annotations (or the corresponding getters/setters).
Proposal:
Change the changeLog attribute of the tracked resource set class of type ChangeLog.
I assign this issue to Frdric as he has the right to push the corresponding code.

I will assign this to myself. I took a second look at the code, wrote a few tests and seems like an EmptyChangeLog behaves the same way as a empty ChangeLog (even if I set an empty change list via changeLog.setChange(new ArrayList<>());):
[6fd87e8b:15c8923c510:-7ffe, http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type, http://open-services.net/ns/core/trs#ChangeLog]
[-3ca719a8:15c892bdc01:-7fff, http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type, http://open-services.net/ns/core/trs#ChangeLog]
Can't tell which one is a Jena model for EmptyChangeLog and which one is for a ChangeLog? That's the point! I suggest removing the class EmptyChangeLog altogether. In 2.2.0 we can start by marking it deprecated.
The bigger problem is what to do with the Change Events themselves. The problem of nave class instantiation in the JenaModelHelper is getting back at us (simple test of the change log with some events, we do marshalling and unmarshalling):
java.lang.AssertionError: Expecting: <[org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.ChangeEvent@7fa98a66, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.ChangeEvent@15ff3e9e, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.ChangeEvent@5fdcaa40]> to contain exactly in any order: <[org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.Modification@3c72f59f, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.Creation@222114ba, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.Deletion@3d121db3]> elements not found: <[org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.Modification@3c72f59f, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.Creation@222114ba, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.Deletion@3d121db3]> and elements not expected: <[org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.ChangeEvent@7fa98a66, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.ChangeEvent@15ff3e9e, org.eclipse.lyo.core.trs.ChangeEvent@5fdcaa40]>
I think we need to switch from a nave class instantiation strategy:
1. Find the class that we request an instance of (JenaModelHelper.fromJenaModel(model, clazz)) 2. Get an OSLC-annotated field 3. Instantiate an instance of the field type and go to step 1.
to a more sophisticate one:
1. Find the class that we request an instance of (JenaModelHelper.fromJenaModel(model, clazz)) 2. Get an OSLC-annotated field 3. Do a reverse lookup of the RDF resource type of the object linked with the same predicate as the annotation. 4. Instantiate an instance of type found during the lookup and go to step 1.
This will allow us to mark the field
ChangeEvent changeEvent;
And when a triple comes in a form of:
:e42 a trs:Modification.
We can make a call
JenaModelHelper.fromJenaModel(model, ChangeEvent.class);
But Jena will instantiate the Modification class because it will be found through a reverse annotation lookup.
Omar, how do you distinguish the ChangeEvent instances in the TRS Consumer? Because I am less comfortable with making ChangeEvent non-abstract, but I have no issue with the replacement of the AbstractChangeLog with a concrete ChangeLog (at least until we come up with the good fix for the JenaModelHelper).

Closing

(In reply to Andrii Berezovskyi from comment #2) > I will assign this to myself. I took a second look at the code, wrote a few > tests and seems like an EmptyChangeLog behaves the same way as a empty > ChangeLog (even if I set an empty change list via changeLog.setChange(new > ArrayList<>());): > > [6fd87e8b:15c8923c510:-7ffe, > http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type, > http://open-services.net/ns/core/trs#ChangeLog] > > [-3ca719a8:15c892bdc01:-7fff, > http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#type, > http://open-services.net/ns/core/trs#ChangeLog] > > Can't tell which one is a Jena model for EmptyChangeLog and which one is for > a ChangeLog? Find the class that we request an instance of > (JenaModelHelper.fromJenaModel(model, clazz)) > 2. Get an OSLC-annotated field > 3. Instantiate an instance of the field type and go to step 1. > > to a more sophisticate one: > > 1. Find the class that we request an instance of > (JenaModelHelper.fromJenaModel(model, clazz)) > 2. Instantiate an instance of type found during the lookup and go to step 1. > > This will allow us to mark the field > > ChangeEvent changeEvent; > > And when a triple comes in a form of: > > :e42 a trs:Modification. > > We can make a call > > JenaModelHelper.fromJenaModel(model, ChangeEvent.class); > > But Jena will instantiate the Modification class because it will be found > through a reverse annotation lookup. > > > Omar, how do you distinguish the ChangeEvent instances in the TRS Consumer? > Because I am less comfortable with making ChangeEvent non-abstract, but I > have no issue with the replacement of the AbstractChangeLog with a concrete > ChangeLog (at least until we come up with the good fix for the > JenaModelHelper).

bug.short_desc: StackOverFlow/OutOfMemory in case of invalid URI in resource

long_desc.thetext:
Hello,
I'm experiencing a StackOverflow or OutOfMemory error, when requesting a configuration resource, as OSLC representation, having a bad URI defined in dcterms:references property.
Because of the stackoverflow/outofmemory, the stacktrace was not printed. Thus I have recorded with Java's Flight Recorder and logged all thrown exception.
When debugging: While reading the resource with JenaModelHelper a URISyntax exception is thrown, and catched by AbstractOslcRdfXmlProvider that tries to build a bad request response. Thereby he fails to get determine the error media type, when getting the acceptable media types.
In the attachments I have added the logged stacktrace when the URISyntax exception is thrown and directly after that, the stacktrace showing the recursive calls.
The first URISyntaxException stacktrace is easy to track, but the second happens in AbstractOslcRdfXmlProvider (line 391), as described earlier.
Created attachment 266616 The thrown URISYntaxException
Created attachment 266617 The inifinite recursive calls after URISyntaxException

FYI, I have also create a bug on jazz.net for their Global Configuration application, which allows to define invalid URIs.
https://jazz.net/jazz/web/projects/Jazz%20Foundation#action=com.ibm.team.workitem.viewWorkItem&id=410948

Hello Benjamin,
First of all, I apologise it took us long to reply. Thank you also for your interest in Lyo and OSLC!
The bug that you have reported seems to relate more to lyo.core than to lyo.client where the bug has surfaced. I also have some problems tracing the bug:
1. OslcRdfXmlProvider.readFrom is a protected method. 2. ClientResponseImpl class is not part of Lyo.
The only problems I have noticed so far are:
1. OslcRdfXmlProvider.readFrom throws WebApplicationException while it is not a webapp per se. 2. OslcRdfXmlProvider.determineErrorMediaType indeed makes strange guesses based on the nullity of certain properties of the object that contains HTTP headers.
In other words, I suspect that ClientResponseImpl does not handle unexpected behaviour from OslcRdfXmlProvider well and goes into infinite recursion itself. Even if that is the case I will be interested to work with you to resolve this strange behaviour.
Could you please give us the RDF that causes the problem and other parameters that are passed to readFrom()? We might be able to get it into the test harness.
As you have mentioned Jazz platform, I CC Jim from IBM here.
Andrew
P.S. Just today I read about the new https://any23.apache.org/ library, might be something worth taking a look at.

Upon further consideration, I decided to close this bug as a duplicate. Let's continue the discussion there.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 423736 ***

attachment.desc: The inifinite recursive calls after URISyntaxException

bug.short_desc: Samples compilation error - cannot find symbol getAbout()

long_desc.thetext:
I've got a problem trying to compile the reference implementations (RIO) and tests from Lyo/OSLC4J.
I've followed the instructions on http://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo/BuildRIO and tried to build OSLC4JQualityManagement (after "mvn install"ing OSLC4JQualityManagementCommon) but I get the following errors:
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:2. 3.2:compile (default-compile) on project oslc4j-qm-sample: Compilation failure: Compilation failure: [ERROR] \dev\eclipse\workspaces\oslc\git\org.eclipse.lyo.rio\OSLC4JQualityManage ment\src\org\eclipse\lyo\oslc4j\qualitymanagement\resources\BaseQmResource.java: [95,37] cannot find symbol [ERROR] symbol : method getAbout() [ERROR] location: class org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.qualitymanagement.QmResource [ERROR] \dev\eclipse\workspaces\oslc\git\org.eclipse.lyo.rio\OSLC4JQualityManage ment\src\org\eclipse\lyo\oslc4j\qualitymanagement\resources\BaseQmResource.java: [131,16] cannot find symbol [ERROR] symbol : method setAbout(java.net.URI) [ERROR] location: class org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.qualitymanagement.QmResource [ERROR] \dev\eclipse\workspaces\oslc\git\org.eclipse.lyo.rio\OSLC4JQualityManage ment\src\org\eclipse\lyo\oslc4j\qualitymanagement\servlet\Populate.java:[68,16] cannot find symbol [ERROR] symbol : method setAbout(java.net.URI) [ERROR] location: class org.eclipse.lyo.oslc4j.qualitymanagement.TestPlan
Something very similar happens with the OSLC4JAutomation sample.
Looking at the code for the first error, it does indeed look like there's a reference to a getAbout() method on a variable that is of a generic type "T extends QmResource", but no such method exists on QmResource (which is exactly what the error's saying) so it doesn't look like a problem with me configuring the build incorrectly. I can't see how this would work.

The instructions for the OSLC4J Change and Quality Management samples is here:
http://wiki.eclipse.org/Lyo/BuildingOSLC4J
You will need to do a Maven install on all of the OSLC4J core projects first (Maven install on OSLC4JCoreRelEng is a shortcut).
Please that. If you are still having problems, I suggest an e-mail to the lyo-dev list.
